definition: a miscalculation that recoils on its maker, to set a controlled fire to halt an advancing forest to prairie fire
details:
noun
- a miscalculation that recoils on its maker
= synonyms: boomerang
- a fire that is set intentionally in order to slow an approaching forest fire or grassfire by clearing a burned area in its path
- a loud noise made by the explosion of fuel in the manifold or exhaust of an internal combustion engine
- the backward escape of gases and unburned gunpowder after a gun is fired
= synonyms: blowback
verb
- to set a controlled fire to halt an advancing forest to prairie fire
= example: to set a controlled fire to halt an advancing forest to prairie fire
- to emit a loud noise as a result of undergoing a backfire
= example: to emit a loud noise as a result of undergoing a backfire
- to come back to the originator of an action with an undesired effect
= example: to come back to the originator of an action with an undesired effect
= synonyms: backlash, recoil
